about.title: About Me
body: I am currently a Robotics Software Engineer at Dexterity, a Series B startup specializing in warehouse automation through intelligent robotics. I hold an MS degree in Mechanical Engineering from UC Berkeley, where I also completed a double major in Mechanical Engineering and Electrical Engineering and Computer Science (EECS).
I have a strong background in control theory, optimization, and computer science. I also have experience in machine learning, robotics, and mechanical design.

Through internships, academic research, and extracurricular activities, I participated in projects ranging from developing novel algorithms for energy efficient autonomous vehicles using Learning Model Predictive Control (LMPC) to designing and building a competitive formula-style racecar. These opportunities have provided me with both exposure and experience, and I hope to continue strengthening my expertise and building new skills.
For a detailed account of my individual projects and experiences, please explore all the pages.

timeline.description: Started undergrad at UC Berkeley pursuing a BS in Mechanical Engineering
Started internship at Ford Greenfield Labs working on simulation research for autonomous vehicles
Graduated from UC Berkeley with double major in Mechanical Engineer and EECS
Started internship at Aptiv working on Controls for autonomous vehicles
Graduated from UC Berkeley with MS in Mechanical Engineering
Started working at Dexterity as a Robotics Software Engineer
